summary: This document is an email chain regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case, indicating that the Deputy Attorney General has determined federal prosecution is appropriate and setting a deadline for Epstein to comply with a plea agreement. It involves communication between legal representatives and possibly prosecutors.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.role: Legal representative or associate involved in Epstein case communications
persons.context: Appears in email correspondence coordinating a call about the Epstein matter, indicating involvement in legal discussions.

persons.name: Jeff Sloman
persons.role: Person who contacted the sender regarding the Epstein matter
persons.context: Mentioned as having contacted the email sender to return a call about Epstein, suggesting a role in legal or prosecutorial communications.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.role: Recipient of an email regarding the Epstein case
persons.context: Addressed in an email discussing the Deputy Attorney General's review and Epstein's plea agreement deadline, likely a legal representative for Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Accused individual subject to federal prosecution
persons.context: Central figure in the case, with the Deputy Attorney General determining federal prosecution is appropriate and a deadline set for his plea agreement compliance.

persons.name: Roy
persons.role: Person to be contacted regarding Epstein matter
persons.context: Mentioned in email regarding coordinating a call about Epstein's case, with a request for contact number.

connections.description: Coordinating a call regarding the Epstein matter, indicating professional collaboration or communication.
Jeff Sloman contacted the sender to return a call about Epstein, suggesting a professional or legal connection.
Email addressed to Lefkowitz discusses Epstein's legal situation and plea agreement, implying Lefkowitz is acting as legal counsel for Epstein.

events.title: Deadline for Epstein's plea agreement compliance
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein has until close of business to comply with terms of agreement with the United States, including guilty plea, sentencing, and surrendering to begin imprisonment.

events.title: Email to Jay Lefkowitz regarding Epstein prosecution
events.description: Email sent informing that Deputy Attorney General completed review and determined federal prosecution of Epstein is appropriate.

events.title: U.S. Attorney's letter modifying agreement
events.description: Reference to a letter from the U.S. Attorney dated December 19th that modified the agreement between the United States and Epstein.

keyFacts: The Deputy Attorney General completed a review and determined federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein is appropriate.
Epstein had a deadline of June 30, 2008, to comply with a plea agreement, including guilty plea, sentencing, and surrendering for imprisonment.
The agreement was modified by a U.S. Attorney's letter dated December 19, 2007.
Email correspondence involves legal representatives (e.g., Jack Goldberger, Jay Lefkowitz) coordinating discussions about Epstein's case.
